Eligibility: Breast cancer continued to grow after receiving hormonal anti-estrogen therapy such as tamoxifen or an aromatase inhibitor.
Menopausal women defined as a woman who has ceased to have menstruation
Treatment with more than one previous anticancer systemic regimen other than endocrine treatment for advanced breast cancer
Treatment with more than one previous endocrine regimen for advanced breast cancer
• An existing disease, disease or serious condition that will prevent participation or compliance with study procedures
Results: An objective response (OR) is defined as a patient with the best overall complete (CR) or partial (PR) response. A patient has the best overall response of CR if she has had an overall response of CR or PR during a visit and meets the criteria for confirmation by RECIST. ROR is defined as the percentage of patients with an objective response.
Each patient with a measurable disease at baseline was evaluated for OR from the sequence of solid tumour response assessment criteria (REST) to the data limit.
Time frame: database and every 12 weeks (+/- 2 weeks) from randomization data to data threshold (March 19, 2008)
Description of the arm/group: Fulvestant 250 mg
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 11.1
Title of arm/group: Fulvestant 250 mg + loading dose
Description of the arm/group: Fulvestant 250 mg + loading dose
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 17.6
